results.title: The Opposite sex. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Robin Hughes and Robin Hughes and Associates
results.brief_description: Dr. Norman Swan narrates this four part series on the differences between men and women. “Part 1. Sex and gender” investigates sexuality and what makes people sexually attractive to each other, concluding that more than the sum of genes, hormones and upbringing is involved. “Part 2. Sex and ability” poses the question “is there such a thing as a male or female brain?” and examines the latest research on the brain. Each program is interspersed with the personal views of ordinary people as well as experts, to demonstrate the range from stereotype to enlightened.

results.title: The Opposite of sex
results.creator_credit: Don Roos, Michael Besman, David Kirkpatrick and Rysher Entertainment
results.brief_description: Christina Ricci stars as 16 year old Dedee Truitt, a teenage Lolita with a caustic tongue and scrupulous libido. ‘The Opposite of Sex’ opens with Dedee running away from her white trash mother to go and stay with her well to do gay half brother Bill (Martin Donovan), and his hunky not too bright boyfriend, Randy (William Lee Scott). Soon enough the malicious vamp has turned everyones life upside down, taking off with her brothers boyfriend and his dead ex-lovers ashes. Writer and director Don Roos has fashioned a sharp witty film which inventively uses Dedee’s voice over narration to plead her case to the audience and to confound our expectations of what she might possibly be thinking next. Ricci is wonderfully droll and jaded in the title role but not to be undone is Lisa Kudrow as the bitter and suspicious sister of Bill’s dead lover. Cast also includes Lyle Lovett, Ivan Sergei, Johnny Galecki

results.title: The Opportunity class
results.creator_credit: Richard Jones and Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Dept. of Film and Television
results.brief_description: A nursery class where handicapped and normal children mix in equal numbers, and where a support program for mothers of the handicapped is arranged. The progress of the children is followed from the nursery to later stages of their education. The attitudes of parents, nursery staff and the children’s later teachers are also explored.

results.title: The Opening: National Gallery of Victoria
results.brief_description: An ABC-TV Outside broadcast introduced by Peter Couchman. The National Gallery of Victoria’s new building, the dream of the Director of the Gallery, Mr. Eric Westbrook, for twelve years came to fruition after four years of planning. The architect, Roy Grounds’ “Vision Splendid” has become a reality and Stage 1 of Victoria’a new art and cultural centre is opened. An on-the-spot film of the opening ceremony in the Great Hall and speech by the Rt. Hon. Sir Henry Bolte. Fanfare composed by George Dreyfus.

results.title: The Opening of the Baden Powell Hut at Brittania Creek, near Warburton, Victoria, October 1954
results.brief_description: Shows Baden Powell Hut opening near Warburton; Brownie Cottage; and a march past in the rain. Of historical value. No credits available.

results.title: The Opening of Parliament House
results.creator_credit: Paul Montgomery, Michael Fitzpatrick and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: With archival footage showing the opening of the old Parliament House and all the splendour of the historic opening of Australia’s new Parliament House, this video is a souvenir of a great occasion and a permanent record of a unique event. It includes the Governor General’s welcome to Her Majesty the Queen, the Honour Guard, a tour of the magnificent new building with its great architectural and engineering achievements and the opening ceremony itself.

results.title: The Open window
results.brief_description: Made with the assistance of Procine S.P.R.L., Brussels, Crown Film Unit and les Films d’Ariel, Paris; this film is devised as a camera impression of the landscape painting of these countries, selected from the works of their greatest painters. The painters whose work are included are Avercamp, Bonington, Bosche, Boudin, Bouts, Broughel, Claude, Constable, Corot, Courbet, Crome, Cuyp, David, De Keuninck, De Leyde, Fragonard, Grimmer, Hobbema, Huet, Jordaens, de Koninck, lancret, Manet, Memling, Michel, Millet, Monet, Wilson, Patenier, Potter, Poussin, Rembrandt, Renior, Rousseau, Rubens, Ruysdael, Stubbs, Turner, Van de Velde, Van Goyen, Verneer and Watteau.

results.title: The Only way out
results.brief_description: A study of decentralisation - Australia is already one of the most highly urbanised countries in the world, and municipal and State authorities are finding it difficult to provide the facilities necessary for large populations. Examines moves towards large-scale decentralisation in South Australia and Albury/Wodonga.

results.title: The Onedin line. Series 2. Part 4
results.brief_description: Albert and Sue’s marriage has reached breaking point with both parties suing for divorce. This is despite Robert and Anne’s best efforts to prevent a move that would disgrace the Onedin Line. Meanwhile, Daniel Fogerty is soon to become a rich man as Emma Callon finally agrees to name a day for their wedding. James is looking towards expanding the Onedin Line. In Dublin, he bids for a new ship, a fast ex slaver, but finds a rival bidder in Daniel Fogerty. Returning home he finds Anne has had a miscarriage and any plans to try and provide James with an heir will seriously threaten her health. James attempts to become the leading shareholder by purchasing 5,000 Onedin steamship shares, but he’s not the only one interested in the purchase. He and Fogerty agree to settle the matter by racing for the first Indian tea crop, with the victor taking the shares. Wily dealings allow Fogerty to turn for home first, but James and his once again pregnant wife, Anne, are closing in. James is forced to make a choice between his wife and control of the company.

results.title: The Onedin line. Series 2. Part 3
results.brief_description: On the ship Pibroch with Captain Baines at the helm, James has an unsettled feeling about the cargo they is carrying. His suspicions are confirmed when, in rough seas off Africa, they discover that she is a coffin ship - old, rotten and overloaded - expected to sink so the owners can claim on the insurance. It’s up to James to save the crew from near death, and to save Captain Baines’ reputation. Meanwhile, Elizabeth’s discovery of Albert’s affair with Carrie Fox threatens their marriage and throws their lives into disarray. Elizabeth is determined to leave him, despite Anne’s protest, before she can act however, Albert decides to give her a taste of life alone when he joins James on a journey around the Horn. On reaching Turkey Albert is offered a job he cannot refuse and experiences a glimpse of love far stronger than any he knew in Liverpool.
